items.title: Garmin Launches Comfortable Arm-Worn Index Sleep Monitor with Week-Long Battery Life
items.author: Andrew Liszewski
items.summary: Garmin’s new Index Sleep Monitor, worn on the upper arm, offers detailed sleep and health tracking with up to seven days of battery life, providing a comfortable alternative to wrist wearables. It tracks sleep stages, heart rate, breathing, and skin temperature, enhancing fitness and recovery insights without nightly charging.

Nintendo Permanently Bans Switch 2 Consoles Using Mig Flash Cartridges
items.author: Cameron Faulkner
items.summary: Nintendo is permanently banning Switch 2 consoles that use Mig flash cartridges to play pirated or copied games, issuing error code 2134-4508 that blocks online access. This strict enforcement reflects Nintendo's ongoing efforts to combat piracy and protect its game ecosystem, impacting users' hardware rather than their accounts.

Bungie Delays Marathon Release to Enhance Gameplay and Visuals
items.author: Jay Peters
items.summary: Bungie postpones the release of its extraction shooter Marathon to improve AI challenge, combat intensity, and visual fidelity while enriching narrative depth and social features. This delay reflects Bungie's commitment to refining player experience and addressing prior feedback, highlighting its dedication to quality.

A Balanced Review of the Nintendo Switch 2 Experience
items.author: David Pierce
items.summary: The Nintendo Switch 2 improves on its predecessor with enhanced features and new games, yet it feels like an incremental upgrade rather than a revolutionary change. The discussion provides insights into its design, gaming experience, and market positioning, highlighting the evolving landscape of handheld consoles. Essential for gamers tracking console innovation and value.

Microsoft should change its Copilot advertising, says watchdog
The Atlantic is making a big push into games
OpenAI awarded $200 million US defense contract
Amazon Prime Day 2025 Extended to Four Days with Major Deals
items.author: Cameron Faulkner
items.summary: Amazon has announced that Prime Day 2025 will run for four days from July 8 to July 11, expanding from its usual two-day duration. This extension offers Prime subscribers a longer window to access significant discounts on Amazon's devices and popular tech products, enhancing shopping opportunities. The event introduces new deal organization features, making it relevant for consumers seeking major savings.

items.title: Tinder now lets you go on double dates
Justin Sun’s Crypto Company Goes Public with Reported Help from Eric Trump
items.author: Tina Nguyen
items.summary: Justin Sun’s crypto platform Tron is going public in the U.S. through a reverse merger with Nasdaq-listed SRM Entertainment, facilitated by Eric Trump. This move follows Sun’s previous SEC investigation and deepening ties with the Trump family, signaling significant developments in the crypto and political intersection.

items.title: Here are the best AirPods deals you can get right now
Nexus Mods Transitions to New Ownership to Ensure Future Growth
items.author: Jay Peters
items.summary: Nexus Mods, the popular PC game modding platform, has been transferred to new leadership to relieve founder Robin “Dark0ne” Scott from burnout. This change promises dedicated management focused on the community and future innovation, ensuring the site’s continued relevance and growth for gamers and modders alike.

items.title: Charge your Apple Watch on this tiny iMac G3 replica
items.author: Andrew Liszewski

items.title: Threads Introduces Spoiler-Hiding Feature to Enhance User Experience
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary: Threads is testing a new feature allowing users to hide spoilers in posts by blurring text or images, improving content consumption. This global test aims to enhance user control over spoiler exposure, a popular feature reminiscent of Reddit’s spoiler tags, signifying Threads' commitment to user-friendly innovations.

items.title: Ford's Super Mustang Mach-E Electric Racer Targets Pikes Peak Victory
items.author: Andrew J. Hawkins
items.summary: Ford unveils the Super Mustang Mach-E, a highly modified electric vehicle designed to conquer the Pikes Peak International Hill Climb with over 1,400 horsepower and unprecedented downforce. This advanced EV demonstrator integrates cutting-edge tech that informs future Ford electric models, highlighting its competitive edge and innovation in high-performance EV racing.

items.title: Reddit Introduces Feature to Integrate Positive User Posts into Advertisements
items.author: Jay Peters
items.summary: Reddit has launched 'Conversation Summary Add-ons,' an AI-driven tool that incorporates positive user posts beneath ads to enhance authenticity and engagement. This feature leverages Reddit Community Intelligence to transform billions of posts into actionable marketing insights, offering brands smarter, community-backed advertising strategies.

items.title: Patreon Raises Fees for New Creators with Updated Pricing Plans
items.author: Dominic Preston
items.summary: Patreon is consolidating its Pro and Premium plans into a single 10% fee plan starting August 5, raising prices for many new creators while preserving existing rates for current users. This change reflects Patreon's expanded services, aiming to better support creator businesses and enhance platform features like video hosting.

items.title: Trump Mobile Offers an Overpriced Prepaid Wireless Plan
items.author: Jacob Kastrenakes
items.summary: Trump Mobile launched a prepaid wireless plan priced at $47.45 with nationwide coverage, unlimited talk and text, and 20GB of 5G data, but it is significantly more expensive than comparable offerings from major carriers and MVNOs. Its unique perks, such as roadside assistance and device protection, may not justify the inflated cost, making it a poor value overall. This highlights the importance of comparing plans beyond branding to find better deals in a crowded market.

items.title: Affordable and versatile Joy-Con charging dock for original Switch and Switch 2 available for $20
items.author: Cameron Faulkner
items.summary: Fastsnail’s Joy-Con charging dock supports both original Switch and Switch 2 controllers for only $20, beating Nintendo’s $30 charger. It’s a practical, cost-effective accessory with intuitive LED indicators and USB-C connectivity, ideal for gamers seeking convenience and compatibility in one device.
